post.description: Creates an application in an account. You must have application creation rights in the respective account. Main properties and application variables can be set with this API.

parameters.name: QB-Realm-Hostname
parameters.description: Your Quick Base domain, for example demo.quickbase.com

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: Information is entered by the person or utility invoking the API. Choose between the default in your toolkit or custom create it. Being as descriptive as possible will help in identification and troubleshooting.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The Quick Base authentication scheme you are using to authenticate the request, as described on the [authentication page](../auth).

schema.description: The example below shows all the properties that can be set with this request. Additional properties that you can see, with the corresponding GET request, cannot be set through this API. See individual property descriptions below for details on how to set or change each.

assignToken.description: Set to true if you would like to assign the app to the user token you used to create the application. The default is false.

name.description: The app name. You are allowed to create multiple apps with the same name, in the same realm, because they will have different dbid values. We urge you to be careful about doing this.

description.description: The description for the app. If this property is left out, the app description will be blank.

Application with defined variables.description: This examples shows the response of an application that contains one or more variables.

name.description: The app name. You are allowed to create multiple apps with the same name, in the same realm, because they will have different dbid values. We urge you to be careful about doing this.

description.description: The description for the app. If this property is left out, the app description will be blank.

created.description: The time and date the app was created, in the ISO 8601 time format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ (in UTC time zone).

updated.description: The time and date the app was last updated, in the ISO 8601 time format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ (in UTC time zone).

dateFormat.description: A description of the format used when displaying date values in this app. Note that this is a browser-only parameter - see the [Field type details](../fieldInfo) page in the API Guide for how time values are returned in API calls. See [About Localizing Dates](https://help.quickbase.com/user-assistance/about_localizing_dates_numbers.html) to set the app’s date format.

timeZone.description: A description of the time zone used when displaying time values in this app. Note that this is a browser-only parameter - see the [Field type details](../fieldInfo) page in the portal for how time values are returned in API calls. See [Set the Time Zone for Both the Application and the Account](https://help.quickbase.com/user-assistance/application_local_timezone.html) to set the application’s time zone.

id.description: The unique identifier for this application.

hasEveryoneOnTheInternet.description: Indicates whether app includes Everyone On The Internet access. See [Sharing apps with Everyone on the Internet (EOTI).](https://help.quickbase.com/user-assistance/share_with_everyone_on_internet.html)

nextRecordId.description: The incremental Record ID that will be used when the next record is created, as determined when the API call was ran.

nextFieldId.description: The incremental Field ID that will be used when the next field is created, as determined when the API call was ran.

defaultSortFieldId.description: The id of the field that is configured for default sorting.

defaultSortOrder.description: The configuration of the default sort order on the table.

keyFieldId.description: The id of the field that is configured to be the key on this table, which is usually the Quick Base Record ID.

singleRecordName.description: The builder-configured singular noun of the table.

pluralRecordName.description: The builder-configured plural noun of the table.

sizeLimit.description: The size limit for the table.

spaceUsed.description: The amount of space currently being used by the table.

spaceRemaining.description: The amount of space remaining for use by the table.

post.description: Runs a report, based on an ID and returns the underlying data associated with it. The format of the data will vary based on the report type. Reports that focus on record-level data (table, calendar, etc.) return the individual records. Aggregate reports (summary, chart) will return the summarized information as configured in the report. UI-specific elements are not returned, such as totals, averages and visualizations. Returns data with intelligent pagination based on the approximate size of each record. The metadata object will include the necessary information to iterate over the response and gather more data.

parameters.name: tableId
parameters.description: The identifier of the table for the report.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of records to skip. You can set this value when paginating through a set of results.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: The maximum number of records to return. You can override the default Quick Base pagination to get more or fewer results. If your requested value here exceeds the dynamic maximums, we will return a subset of results and the rest can be gathered in subsequent API calls.

parameters.name: QB-Realm-Hostname
parameters.description: Your Quick Base domain, for example demo.quickbase.com

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: This is entered by the person or utility invoking the API. You might custom create this or use the default one of your toolkit. Being descriptive here may offer more identification and troubleshooting capabilities.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The Quick Base authentication scheme you are using to authenticate the request, as described on the [authentication page](../auth).

fields.description: An array of objects that contains limited meta-data of each field displayed in the report. This assists in building logic that depends on field types and IDs.

id.description: Field id.

data.description: An array of objects that either represents the record data or summarized values, depending on the report type.

metadata.description: Additional information about the results that may be helpful. Pagination may be needed if either you specify a smaller number of results to skip than is available, or if the API automatically returns fewer results. numRecords can be compared to totalRecords to determine if further pagination is needed.

skip.description: The number of records to skip

numFields.description: The number of fields in each record in the current response object

top.description: If present, the maximum number of records requested by the caller

totalRecords.description: The total number of records in the result set

numRecords.description: The number of records in the current response object

get.description: Gets the properties for all fields in a specific table. The properties for each field are the same as in Get field.

parameters.name: tableId
parameters.description: The unique identifier (dbid) of the table.

parameters.name: includeFieldPerms
parameters.description: Set to 'true' if you'd like to get back the custom permissions for the field(s).

parameters.name: QB-Realm-Hostname
parameters.description: Your Quick Base domain, for example demo.quickbase.com

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: This is entered by the person or utility invoking the API. You might custom create this or use the default one of your toolkit. Being descriptive here may offer more identification and troubleshooting capabilities.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The Quick Base authentication scheme you are using to authenticate the request, as described on the [authentication page](../auth).

id.description: The id of the field, unique to this table.

fieldType.description: The type of field, as described [here](https://help.quickbase.com/user-assistance/field_types.html).

mode.description: Only present for derived fields. Lookup, summary or virtual (formula).

noWrap.description: Indicates if the field is configured to not wrap when displayed in the product.

bold.description: Indicates if the field is configured to display in bold in the product.

required.description: Indicates if the field is marked required.

appearsByDefault.description: Indicates if the field is marked as a default in reports.

findEnabled.description: Indicates if the field is marked as searchable.

allowNewChoices.description: Indicates if users can add new choices to a selection list.

sortAsGiven.description: Indicates if the listed entries sort as entered vs alphabetically.

carryChoices.description: Whether the field should carry its multiple choice fields when copied.

foreignKey.description: Indicates if the field is a foreign key (or reference field) in a relationship.

unique.description: Indicates if the field is marked unique.

doesDataCopy.description: Indicates if the field data will copy when a user copies the record.

fieldHelp.description: The configured help text shown to users within the product.

audited.description: Indicates if the field is being tracked as part of Quick Base Audit Logs.

numLines.description: The number of lines shown in the Quick Base product for this text field.

maxLength.description: The maximum number of characters allowed for entry in the Quick Base product for this field.

appendOnly.description: Whether this field is append only.

hasExtension.description: Whether this field has a phone extension.

decimalPlaces.description: The number of decimal places displayed in the product for this field.

commaStart.description: The number of digits before commas display in the product, when applicable.

numberFormat.description: The format used for displaying numeric values in the product (decimal, separators, digit group).

doesAverage.description: Whether this field averages in reports within the product.

doesTotal.description: Whether this field totals in reports within the product.

blankIsZero.description: Whether a blank value is treated the same as 0 in calculations within the product.

currencySymbol.description: The current symbol used when displaying field values within the product.

currencyFormat.description: The currency format used when displaying field values within the product.

displayTime.description: Indicates whether to display the time, in addition to the date.

displayRelative.description: Whether to display time as relative.

defaultToday.description: Indicates if the field value is defaulted today for new records.

displayDayOfWeek.description: Indicates whether to display the day of the week within the product.

displayTimezone.description: Indicates whether to display the timezone within the product.

hours24.description: Indicates whether or not to display time in the 24-hour format within the product.

displayUser.description: The configured option for how users display within the product.

choices.description: An array of entries that exist for a field that offers choices to the user.

compositeFields.description: An array of the fields that make up a composite field (e.g., address).

targetTableId.description: The id of the target table.

targetFieldId.description: The id of the target field.

sourceFieldId.description: The id of the source field.

useNewWindow.description: Indicates if the URL should open a new window when a user clicks it within the product.

linkText.description: The configured text value that replaces the URL that users see within the product.

exact.description: Whether an exact match is required for a report link.

displayImages.description: Indicates whether images will display for file attachments on forms and reports within the product.

appearsAs.description: The link text, if empty, the url will be used as link text.

abbreviate.description: Don't show the URL protocol when showing the URL.

autoSave.description: Whether the link field will auto save.

displayAsLink.description: Indicates if a field that is part of the relationship should be shown as a hyperlink to the parent record within the product.

sortAlpha.description: Whether to sort alphabetically, default sort is by record ID.

versionMode.description: Version modes for files. Keep all versions vs keep last version.

maxVersions.description: The maximum number of versions configured for a file attachment.

seeVersions.description: Indicates if the user can see other versions, aside from the most recent, of a file attachment within the product.

width.description: The field's html input width in the product.

formula.description: The formula of the field as configured in Quick Base.

defaultValue.description: The default value configured for a field when a new record is added.

comments.description: The comments entered on the field properties by an administrator.

masterChoiceTableId.description: The id of the table that is the master in this relationship.

masterChoiceFieldId.description: The id of the field that is the reference in the relationship.

snapFieldId.description: The id of the field that is used to snapshot values from, when applicable.

parentFieldId.description: The id of the parent composite field, when applicable.

lookupTargetFieldId.description: The id of the field that is the target on the master table for this lookup.

lookupReferenceFieldId.description: The id of the field that is the reference in the relationship for this lookup.

summaryReferenceFieldId.description: The id of the field that is the reference in the relationship for this summary.

summaryTargetFieldId.description: The id of the field that is used to aggregate values from the child, when applicable. This displays 0 if the summary function doesn’t require a field selection (like count).

masterTableTag.description: The table alias for the master table in the relationship this field is part of.

role.description: The role associated with a given permission for the field

permissionType.description: The permission given to the role for this field

roleId.description: The Id of the given role

post.description:
Insert and/or update record(s) in a table. In this single API call, inserts and updates can be submitted. Update can use the key field on the table, or any other supported unique field. Refer to this [page](../fieldInfo) for more information about how each field type should be formatted. This operation allows for incremental processing of successful records, even when some of the records fail.  
**Note:** This endpoint supports a maximum payload size of 10MB.

parameters.name: QB-Realm-Hostname
parameters.description: Your Quick Base domain, for example demo.quickbase.com

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: This is entered by the person or utility invoking the API. You might custom create this or use the default one of your toolkit. Being descriptive here may offer more identification and troubleshooting capabilities.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The Quick Base authentication scheme you are using to authenticate the request, as described on the [authentication page](../auth).

fieldsToReturn.description: Specify an array of field ids that will return data for any updates or added record. Record ID (FID 3) is always returned if any field ID is requested.

200.description: A successful response that includes details on the records added, updated or unchanged.

Simple Response.description: In this example, the table previously had ten records with IDs from 1 through 10. The user posts an upsert that updates the value of record 1 and adds two new records, all successfully.

Response with Line Errors.description: If there are errors processing any individual records, the response will still be an HTTP 200, and individual errors will be reported under the “lineErrors” element.  In this example, a user tries to add three records to a table that previously had ten records with IDs from 1 through 10.  The first and third records of the request are valid and create the 11th and 12th records in the table; the second record has a problem that prevents it from being processed.

2: Incompatible value for field with ID "6".

createdRecordIds.description: Array containing the created record ids.

lineErrors.description: This will only be returned in the case of failed records. It is a collection of errors that occurred when processing the incoming data that resulted in records not being processed. Each object has a key representing the sequence number of the record in the original payload (starting from 1). The value is a list of errors occurred.

unchangedRecordIds.description: Array containing the unchanged record ids.

updatedRecordIds.description: Array containing the updated record ids.

totalNumberOfRecordsProcessed.description: Number of records processed. Includes successful and failed record updates.

delete.description: Deletes record(s) in a table based on a query. Alternatively, all records in the table can be deleted.

parameters.description: Your Quick Base domain, for example demo.quickbase.com

parameters.description: The Quick Base authentication scheme you are using to authenticate the request, as described on the [authentication page](../auth).

from.description: The unique identifier of the table.

where.description: The filter to delete records. To delete all records specify a filter that will include all records, for example {3.GT.0} where 3 is the ID of the Record ID field.

post.description: Pass in a query in the [Quick Base query language](https://help.quickbase.com/api-guide/componentsquery.html). Returns record data with intelligent pagination based on the approximate size of each record. The metadata object will include the necessary information to iterate over the response and gather more data.

parameters.description: Your Quick Base domain, for example demo.quickbase.com

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: This is entered by the person or utility invoking the API. You might custom create this or use the default one of your toolkit. Being descriptive here may offer more identification and troubleshooting capabilities.

parameters.description: The Quick Base authentication scheme you are using to authenticate the request, as described on the [authentication page](../auth).

schema.description: If grouping or sorting is not set, records will not be sorted.

skip.description: The number of records to skip.

top.description: The maximum number of records to display.

where.description: The filter, using the Quick Base query language, which determines the records to return.

groupBy.description: An array that contains the fields to group the records by.

grouping.description: Group by based on ascending order(ASC), descending order(DESC) or equal values(equal-values)

sortBy.description: By default, queries will be sorted by the given sort fields or the default sort if the query does not provide any. Set to false to avoid sorting when the order of the data returned is not important. Returning data without sorting can improve performance.

select.description: An array of field ids for the fields that should be returned in the response. If empty, the default columns on the table will be returned.

fields.description: An array of objects that contains limited meta-data of each field displayed in the report. This assists in building logic that depends on field types and IDs.

id.description: Field id.

data.description: An array of objects that either represents the record data or summarized values, depending on the report type.

metadata.description: Additional information about the results that may be helpful. Pagination may be needed if either you specify a smaller number of results to skip than is available, or if the API automatically returns fewer results. numRecords can be compared to totalRecords to determine if further pagination is needed.

skip.description: The number of records to skip

numFields.description: The number of fields in each record in the current response object

top.description: If present, the maximum number of records requested by the caller

totalRecords.description: The total number of records in the result set

numRecords.description: The number of records in the current response object

get.description: This endpoint responds with temporary authorization token that is scoped to either an app or a table (depending on the dbid) and can be used to make other api calls. This token expires in 5 minutes. Use this call in a JavaScript code page to leverage the current user’s authentication.

operations.description: Creates an application in an account. You must have application creation rights in the respective account. Main properties and application variables can be set with this API.

parameters.name: QB-Realm-Hostname
parameters.description: Your Quick Base domain, for example demo.quickbase.com

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: Information is entered by the person or utility invoking the API. Choose between the default in your toolkit or custom create it. Being as descriptive as possible will help in identification and troubleshooting.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The Quick Base authentication scheme you are using to authenticate the request, as described on the [authentication page](../auth).

schema.description: The example below shows all the properties that can be set with this request. Additional properties that you can see, with the corresponding GET request, cannot be set through this API. See individual property descriptions below for details on how to set or change each.

assignToken.description: Set to true if you would like to assign the app to the user token you used to create the application. The default is false.

name.description: The app name. You are allowed to create multiple apps with the same name, in the same realm, because they will have different dbid values. We urge you to be careful about doing this.

description.description: The description for the app. If this property is left out, the app description will be blank.

Application with defined variables.description: This examples shows the response of an application that contains one or more variables.

name.description: The app name. You are allowed to create multiple apps with the same name, in the same realm, because they will have different dbid values. We urge you to be careful about doing this.

description.description: The description for the app. If this property is left out, the app description will be blank.

created.description: The time and date the app was created, in the ISO 8601 time format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ (in UTC time zone).

updated.description: The time and date the app was last updated, in the ISO 8601 time format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ (in UTC time zone).

dateFormat.description: A description of the format used when displaying date values in this app. Note that this is a browser-only parameter - see the [Field type details](../fieldInfo) page in the API Guide for how time values are returned in API calls. See [About Localizing Dates](https://help.quickbase.com/user-assistance/about_localizing_dates_numbers.html) to set the app’s date format.

timeZone.description: A description of the time zone used when displaying time values in this app. Note that this is a browser-only parameter - see the [Field type details](../fieldInfo) page in the portal for how time values are returned in API calls. See [Set the Time Zone for Both the Application and the Account](https://help.quickbase.com/user-assistance/application_local_timezone.html) to set the application’s time zone.

id.description: The unique identifier for this application.

hasEveryoneOnTheInternet.description: Indicates whether app includes Everyone On The Internet access. See [Sharing apps with Everyone on the Internet (EOTI).](https://help.quickbase.com/user-assistance/share_with_everyone_on_internet.html)

pluralRecordName.description: The plural noun for records in the table. If this value is not passed the default value is 'Records'.

singleRecordName.description: The singular noun for records in the table. If this value is not passed the default value is 'Record'.

description.description: The description for the table. If this value is not passed the default value is blank.

id.description: The unique identifier (dbid) of the table.

alias.description: The automatically-created table alias for the table.

description.description: The description of the table, as configured by an application administrator.

created.description: The time and date when the table was created, in the ISO 8601 time format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ (in UTC time zone).

updated.description: The time and date when the table schema or data was last updated, in the ISO 8601 time format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ (in UTC time zone).

nextRecordId.description: The incremental Record ID that will be used when the next record is created, as determined when the API call was ran.

nextFieldId.description: The incremental Field ID that will be used when the next field is created, as determined when the API call was ran.

defaultSortFieldId.description: The id of the field that is configured for default sorting.

defaultSortOrder.description: The configuration of the default sort order on the table.

keyFieldId.description: The id of the field that is configured to be the key on this table, which is usually the Quick Base Record ID.

singleRecordName.description: The builder-configured singular noun of the table.

pluralRecordName.description: The builder-configured plural noun of the table.

sizeLimit.description: The size limit for the table.

spaceUsed.description: The amount of space currently being used by the table.

spaceRemaining.description: The amount of space remaining for use by the table.

operations.description: Runs a report, based on an ID and returns the underlying data associated with it. The format of the data will vary based on the report type. Reports that focus on record-level data (table, calendar, etc.) return the individual records. Aggregate reports (summary, chart) will return the summarized information as configured in the report. UI-specific elements are not returned, such as totals, averages and visualizations. Returns data with intelligent pagination based on the approximate size of each record. The metadata object will include the necessary information to iterate over the response and gather more data.

parameters.name: reportId
parameters.description: The identifier of the report, unique to the table.

parameters.name: tableId
parameters.description: The identifier of the table for the report.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of records to skip. You can set this value when paginating through a set of results.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: The maximum number of records to return. You can override the default Quick Base pagination to get more or fewer results. If your requested value here exceeds the dynamic maximums, we will return a subset of results and the rest can be gathered in subsequent API calls.

parameters.name: QB-Realm-Hostname
parameters.description: Your Quick Base domain, for example demo.quickbase.com

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The Quick Base authentication scheme you are using to authenticate the request, as described on the [authentication page](../auth).

fields.description: An array of objects that contains limited meta-data of each field displayed in the report. This assists in building logic that depends on field types and IDs.

id.description: Field id.

data.description: An array of objects that either represents the record data or summarized values, depending on the report type.

metadata.description: Additional information about the results that may be helpful. Pagination may be needed if either you specify a smaller number of results to skip than is available, or if the API automatically returns fewer results. numRecords can be compared to totalRecords to determine if further pagination is needed.

skip.description: The number of records to skip

numFields.description: The number of fields in each record in the current response object

top.description: If present, the maximum number of records requested by the caller

totalRecords.description: The total number of records in the result set

numRecords.description: The number of records in the current response object

id.description: The id of the field, unique to this table.

fieldType.description: The type of field, as described [here](https://help.quickbase.com/user-assistance/field_types.html).

mode.description: Only present for derived fields. Lookup, summary or virtual (formula).

noWrap.description: Indicates if the field is configured to not wrap when displayed in the product.

bold.description: Indicates if the field is configured to display in bold in the product.

required.description: Indicates if the field is marked required.

appearsByDefault.description: Indicates if the field is marked as a default in reports.

findEnabled.description: Indicates if the field is marked as searchable.

allowNewChoices.description: Indicates if users can add new choices to a selection list.

sortAsGiven.description: Indicates if the listed entries sort as entered vs alphabetically.

carryChoices.description: Whether the field should carry its multiple choice fields when copied.

foreignKey.description: Indicates if the field is a foreign key (or reference field) in a relationship.

unique.description: Indicates if the field is marked unique.

doesDataCopy.description: Indicates if the field data will copy when a user copies the record.

fieldHelp.description: The configured help text shown to users within the product.

audited.description: Indicates if the field is being tracked as part of Quick Base Audit Logs.

numLines.description: The number of lines shown in the Quick Base product for this text field.

maxLength.description: The maximum number of characters allowed for entry in the Quick Base product for this field.

appendOnly.description: Whether this field is append only.

hasExtension.description: Whether this field has a phone extension.

decimalPlaces.description: The number of decimal places displayed in the product for this field.

commaStart.description: The number of digits before commas display in the product, when applicable.

numberFormat.description: The format used for displaying numeric values in the product (decimal, separators, digit group).

doesAverage.description: Whether this field averages in reports within the product.

doesTotal.description: Whether this field totals in reports within the product.

blankIsZero.description: Whether a blank value is treated the same as 0 in calculations within the product.

currencySymbol.description: The current symbol used when displaying field values within the product.

currencyFormat.description: The currency format used when displaying field values within the product.

displayTime.description: Indicates whether to display the time, in addition to the date.

displayRelative.description: Whether to display time as relative.

defaultToday.description: Indicates if the field value is defaulted today for new records.

displayDayOfWeek.description: Indicates whether to display the day of the week within the product.

displayTimezone.description: Indicates whether to display the timezone within the product.

hours24.description: Indicates whether or not to display time in the 24-hour format within the product.

displayUser.description: The configured option for how users display within the product.

choices.description: An array of entries that exist for a field that offers choices to the user.

compositeFields.description: An array of the fields that make up a composite field (e.g., address).

targetTableId.description: The id of the target table.

targetFieldId.description: The id of the target field.

sourceFieldId.description: The id of the source field.

useNewWindow.description: Indicates if the URL should open a new window when a user clicks it within the product.

linkText.description: The configured text value that replaces the URL that users see within the product.

exact.description: Whether an exact match is required for a report link.

displayImages.description: Indicates whether images will display for file attachments on forms and reports within the product.

appearsAs.description: The link text, if empty, the url will be used as link text.

abbreviate.description: Don't show the URL protocol when showing the URL.

autoSave.description: Whether the link field will auto save.

displayAsLink.description: Indicates if a field that is part of the relationship should be shown as a hyperlink to the parent record within the product.

sortAlpha.description: Whether to sort alphabetically, default sort is by record ID.

versionMode.description: Version modes for files. Keep all versions vs keep last version.

maxVersions.description: The maximum number of versions configured for a file attachment.

seeVersions.description: Indicates if the user can see other versions, aside from the most recent, of a file attachment within the product.

width.description: The field's html input width in the product.

formula.description: The formula of the field as configured in Quick Base.

defaultValue.description: The default value configured for a field when a new record is added.

comments.description: The comments entered on the field properties by an administrator.

masterChoiceTableId.description: The id of the table that is the master in this relationship.

masterChoiceFieldId.description: The id of the field that is the reference in the relationship.

snapFieldId.description: The id of the field that is used to snapshot values from, when applicable.

parentFieldId.description: The id of the parent composite field, when applicable.

lookupTargetFieldId.description: The id of the field that is the target on the master table for this lookup.

lookupReferenceFieldId.description: The id of the field that is the reference in the relationship for this lookup.

summaryReferenceFieldId.description: The id of the field that is the reference in the relationship for this summary.

summaryTargetFieldId.description: The id of the field that is used to aggregate values from the child, when applicable. This displays 0 if the summary function doesn’t require a field selection (like count).

masterTableTag.description: The table alias for the master table in the relationship this field is part of.

role.description: The role associated with a given permission for the field

permissionType.description: The permission given to the role for this field

roleId.description: The Id of the given role

operations.description:
Insert and/or update record(s) in a table. In this single API call, inserts and updates can be submitted. Update can use the key field on the table, or any other supported unique field. Refer to this [page](../fieldInfo) for more information about how each field type should be formatted. This operation allows for incremental processing of successful records, even when some of the records fail.  
**Note:** This endpoint supports a maximum payload size of 10MB.

parameters.name: QB-Realm-Hostname
parameters.description: Your Quick Base domain, for example demo.quickbase.com

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: This is entered by the person or utility invoking the API. You might custom create this or use the default one of your toolkit. Being descriptive here may offer more identification and troubleshooting capabilities.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The Quick Base authentication scheme you are using to authenticate the request, as described on the [authentication page](../auth).

fieldsToReturn.description: Specify an array of field ids that will return data for any updates or added record. Record ID (FID 3) is always returned if any field ID is requested.

200.description: A successful response that includes details on the records added, updated or unchanged.

Simple Response.description: In this example, the table previously had ten records with IDs from 1 through 10. The user posts an upsert that updates the value of record 1 and adds two new records, all successfully.

Response with Line Errors.description: If there are errors processing any individual records, the response will still be an HTTP 200, and individual errors will be reported under the “lineErrors” element.  In this example, a user tries to add three records to a table that previously had ten records with IDs from 1 through 10.  The first and third records of the request are valid and create the 11th and 12th records in the table; the second record has a problem that prevents it from being processed.

2: Incompatible value for field with ID "6".

createdRecordIds.description: Array containing the created record ids.

lineErrors.description: This will only be returned in the case of failed records. It is a collection of errors that occurred when processing the incoming data that resulted in records not being processed. Each object has a key representing the sequence number of the record in the original payload (starting from 1). The value is a list of errors occurred.

unchangedRecordIds.description: Array containing the unchanged record ids.

updatedRecordIds.description: Array containing the updated record ids.

totalNumberOfRecordsProcessed.description: Number of records processed. Includes successful and failed record updates.

schema.description: If grouping or sorting is not set, records will not be sorted.

skip.description: The number of records to skip.

top.description: The maximum number of records to display.

where.description: The filter, using the Quick Base query language, which determines the records to return.

groupBy.description: An array that contains the fields to group the records by.

grouping.description: Group by based on ascending order(ASC), descending order(DESC) or equal values(equal-values)

sortBy.description: By default, queries will be sorted by the given sort fields or the default sort if the query does not provide any. Set to false to avoid sorting when the order of the data returned is not important. Returning data without sorting can improve performance.

select.description: An array of field ids for the fields that should be returned in the response. If empty, the default columns on the table will be returned.

fields.description: An array of objects that contains limited meta-data of each field displayed in the report. This assists in building logic that depends on field types and IDs.

id.description: Field id.

data.description: An array of objects that either represents the record data or summarized values, depending on the report type.

metadata.description: Additional information about the results that may be helpful. Pagination may be needed if either you specify a smaller number of results to skip than is available, or if the API automatically returns fewer results. numRecords can be compared to totalRecords to determine if further pagination is needed.

skip.description: The number of records to skip

numFields.description: The number of fields in each record in the current response object

top.description: If present, the maximum number of records requested by the caller

totalRecords.description: The total number of records in the result set

numRecords.description: The number of records in the current response object

schema.description: The example below shows all the properties that can be set with this request. Additional properties that you can see, with the corresponding GET request, cannot be set through this API. See individual property descriptions below for details on how to set or change each.

assignToken.description: Set to true if you would like to assign the app to the user token you used to create the application. The default is false.

name.description: The app name. You are allowed to create multiple apps with the same name, in the same realm, because they will have different dbid values. We urge you to be careful about doing this.

description.description: The description for the app. If this property is left out, the app description will be blank.

created.description: The time and date the app was created, in the ISO 8601 time format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ (in UTC time zone).

updated.description: The time and date the app was last updated, in the ISO 8601 time format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ (in UTC time zone).

dateFormat.description: A description of the format used when displaying date values in this app. Note that this is a browser-only parameter - see the [Field type details](../fieldInfo) page in the API Guide for how time values are returned in API calls. See [About Localizing Dates](https://help.quickbase.com/user-assistance/about_localizing_dates_numbers.html) to set the app’s date format.

timeZone.description: A description of the time zone used when displaying time values in this app. Note that this is a browser-only parameter - see the [Field type details](../fieldInfo) page in the portal for how time values are returned in API calls. See [Set the Time Zone for Both the Application and the Account](https://help.quickbase.com/user-assistance/application_local_timezone.html) to set the application’s time zone.

id.description: The unique identifier for this application.

hasEveryoneOnTheInternet.description: Indicates whether app includes Everyone On The Internet access. See [Sharing apps with Everyone on the Internet (EOTI).](https://help.quickbase.com/user-assistance/share_with_everyone_on_internet.html)

Reports.description: Runs a report, based on an ID and returns the underlying data associated with it. The format of the data will vary based on the report type. Reports that focus on record-level data (table, calendar, etc.) return the individual records. Aggregate reports (summary, chart) will return the summarized information as configured in the report. UI-specific elements are not returned, such as totals, averages and visualizations. Returns data with intelligent pagination based on the approximate size of each record. The metadata object will include the necessary information to iterate over the response and gather more data.

parameters.name: reportId
parameters.description: The identifier of the report, unique to the table.

parameters.name: tableId
parameters.description: The identifier of the table for the report.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of records to skip. You can set this value when paginating through a set of results.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: The maximum number of records to return. You can override the default Quick Base pagination to get more or fewer results. If your requested value here exceeds the dynamic maximums, we will return a subset of results and the rest can be gathered in subsequent API calls.

parameters.description: Your Quick Base domain, for example demo.quickbase.com

fields.description: An array of objects that contains limited meta-data of each field displayed in the report. This assists in building logic that depends on field types and IDs.

id.description: Field id.

data.description: An array of objects that either represents the record data or summarized values, depending on the report type.

metadata.description: Additional information about the results that may be helpful. Pagination may be needed if either you specify a smaller number of results to skip than is available, or if the API automatically returns fewer results. numRecords can be compared to totalRecords to determine if further pagination is needed.

skip.description: The number of records to skip

numFields.description: The number of fields in each record in the current response object

top.description: If present, the maximum number of records requested by the caller

totalRecords.description: The total number of records in the result set

numRecords.description: The number of records in the current response object

parameters.description: Set to 'true' if you'd like to get back the custom permissions for the field(s).

parameters.description: This is entered by the person or utility invoking the API. You might custom create this or use the default one of your toolkit. Being descriptive here may offer more identification and troubleshooting capabilities.

parameters.description: The Quick Base authentication scheme you are using to authenticate the request, as described on the [authentication page](../auth).

id.description: The id of the field, unique to this table.

fieldType.description: The type of field, as described [here](https://help.quickbase.com/user-assistance/field_types.html).

mode.description: Only present for derived fields. Lookup, summary or virtual (formula).

noWrap.description: Indicates if the field is configured to not wrap when displayed in the product.

bold.description: Indicates if the field is configured to display in bold in the product.

required.description: Indicates if the field is marked required.

appearsByDefault.description: Indicates if the field is marked as a default in reports.

findEnabled.description: Indicates if the field is marked as searchable.

allowNewChoices.description: Indicates if users can add new choices to a selection list.

sortAsGiven.description: Indicates if the listed entries sort as entered vs alphabetically.

carryChoices.description: Whether the field should carry its multiple choice fields when copied.

foreignKey.description: Indicates if the field is a foreign key (or reference field) in a relationship.

unique.description: Indicates if the field is marked unique.

doesDataCopy.description: Indicates if the field data will copy when a user copies the record.

fieldHelp.description: The configured help text shown to users within the product.

audited.description: Indicates if the field is being tracked as part of Quick Base Audit Logs.

numLines.description: The number of lines shown in the Quick Base product for this text field.

maxLength.description: The maximum number of characters allowed for entry in the Quick Base product for this field.

appendOnly.description: Whether this field is append only.

hasExtension.description: Whether this field has a phone extension.

decimalPlaces.description: The number of decimal places displayed in the product for this field.

commaStart.description: The number of digits before commas display in the product, when applicable.

numberFormat.description: The format used for displaying numeric values in the product (decimal, separators, digit group).

doesAverage.description: Whether this field averages in reports within the product.

doesTotal.description: Whether this field totals in reports within the product.

blankIsZero.description: Whether a blank value is treated the same as 0 in calculations within the product.

currencySymbol.description: The current symbol used when displaying field values within the product.

currencyFormat.description: The currency format used when displaying field values within the product.

displayTime.description: Indicates whether to display the time, in addition to the date.

displayRelative.description: Whether to display time as relative.

defaultToday.description: Indicates if the field value is defaulted today for new records.

displayDayOfWeek.description: Indicates whether to display the day of the week within the product.

displayTimezone.description: Indicates whether to display the timezone within the product.

hours24.description: Indicates whether or not to display time in the 24-hour format within the product.

displayUser.description: The configured option for how users display within the product.

choices.description: An array of entries that exist for a field that offers choices to the user.

compositeFields.description: An array of the fields that make up a composite field (e.g., address).

targetTableId.description: The id of the target table.

targetFieldId.description: The id of the target field.

sourceFieldId.description: The id of the source field.

useNewWindow.description: Indicates if the URL should open a new window when a user clicks it within the product.

linkText.description: The configured text value that replaces the URL that users see within the product.

exact.description: Whether an exact match is required for a report link.

displayImages.description: Indicates whether images will display for file attachments on forms and reports within the product.

appearsAs.description: The link text, if empty, the url will be used as link text.

abbreviate.description: Don't show the URL protocol when showing the URL.

autoSave.description: Whether the link field will auto save.

displayAsLink.description: Indicates if a field that is part of the relationship should be shown as a hyperlink to the parent record within the product.

sortAlpha.description: Whether to sort alphabetically, default sort is by record ID.

versionMode.description: Version modes for files. Keep all versions vs keep last version.

maxVersions.description: The maximum number of versions configured for a file attachment.

seeVersions.description: Indicates if the user can see other versions, aside from the most recent, of a file attachment within the product.

width.description: The field's html input width in the product.

formula.description: The formula of the field as configured in Quick Base.

defaultValue.description: The default value configured for a field when a new record is added.

comments.description: The comments entered on the field properties by an administrator.

masterChoiceTableId.description: The id of the table that is the master in this relationship.

masterChoiceFieldId.description: The id of the field that is the reference in the relationship.

snapFieldId.description: The id of the field that is used to snapshot values from, when applicable.

parentFieldId.description: The id of the parent composite field, when applicable.

lookupTargetFieldId.description: The id of the field that is the target on the master table for this lookup.

lookupReferenceFieldId.description: The id of the field that is the reference in the relationship for this lookup.

summaryReferenceFieldId.description: The id of the field that is the reference in the relationship for this summary.

summaryTargetFieldId.description: The id of the field that is used to aggregate values from the child, when applicable. This displays 0 if the summary function doesn’t require a field selection (like count).

masterTableTag.description: The table alias for the master table in the relationship this field is part of.

role.description: The role associated with a given permission for the field

permissionType.description: The permission given to the role for this field

roleId.description: The Id of the given role

appendOnly.description: Whether this field is append only.

noWrap.description: Indicates if the field is configured to not wrap when displayed in the product.

Records.description:
Insert and/or update record(s) in a table. In this single API call, inserts and updates can be submitted. Update can use the key field on the table, or any other supported unique field. Refer to this [page](../fieldInfo) for more information about how each field type should be formatted. This operation allows for incremental processing of successful records, even when some of the records fail.  
**Note:** This endpoint supports a maximum payload size of 10MB.

parameters.name: QB-Realm-Hostname
parameters.description: Your Quick Base domain, for example demo.quickbase.com

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: This is entered by the person or utility invoking the API. You might custom create this or use the default one of your toolkit. Being descriptive here may offer more identification and troubleshooting capabilities.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The Quick Base authentication scheme you are using to authenticate the request, as described on the [authentication page](../auth).

fieldsToReturn.description: Specify an array of field ids that will return data for any updates or added record. Record ID (FID 3) is always returned if any field ID is requested.

200.description: A successful response that includes details on the records added, updated or unchanged.

Simple Response.description: In this example, the table previously had ten records with IDs from 1 through 10. The user posts an upsert that updates the value of record 1 and adds two new records, all successfully.

Response with Line Errors.description: If there are errors processing any individual records, the response will still be an HTTP 200, and individual errors will be reported under the “lineErrors” element.  In this example, a user tries to add three records to a table that previously had ten records with IDs from 1 through 10.  The first and third records of the request are valid and create the 11th and 12th records in the table; the second record has a problem that prevents it from being processed.

2: Incompatible value for field with ID "6".

createdRecordIds.description: Array containing the created record ids.

lineErrors.description: This will only be returned in the case of failed records. It is a collection of errors that occurred when processing the incoming data that resulted in records not being processed. Each object has a key representing the sequence number of the record in the original payload (starting from 1). The value is a list of errors occurred.

unchangedRecordIds.description: Array containing the unchanged record ids.

updatedRecordIds.description: Array containing the updated record ids.

totalNumberOfRecordsProcessed.description: Number of records processed. Includes successful and failed record updates.

Records.description: Pass in a query in the [Quick Base query language](https://help.quickbase.com/api-guide/componentsquery.html). Returns record data with intelligent pagination based on the approximate size of each record. The metadata object will include the necessary information to iterate over the response and gather more data.

parameters.description: Your Quick Base domain, for example demo.quickbase.com

schema.description: If grouping or sorting is not set, records will not be sorted.

skip.description: The number of records to skip.

top.description: The maximum number of records to display.

where.description: The filter, using the Quick Base query language, which determines the records to return.

groupBy.description: An array that contains the fields to group the records by.

grouping.description: Group by based on ascending order(ASC), descending order(DESC) or equal values(equal-values)

sortBy.description: By default, queries will be sorted by the given sort fields or the default sort if the query does not provide any. Set to false to avoid sorting when the order of the data returned is not important. Returning data without sorting can improve performance.

select.description: An array of field ids for the fields that should be returned in the response. If empty, the default columns on the table will be returned.

fields.description: An array of objects that contains limited meta-data of each field displayed in the report. This assists in building logic that depends on field types and IDs.

id.description: Field id.

data.description: An array of objects that either represents the record data or summarized values, depending on the report type.

metadata.description: Additional information about the results that may be helpful. Pagination may be needed if either you specify a smaller number of results to skip than is available, or if the API automatically returns fewer results. numRecords can be compared to totalRecords to determine if further pagination is needed.

skip.description: The number of records to skip

numFields.description: The number of fields in each record in the current response object

top.description: If present, the maximum number of records requested by the caller

totalRecords.description: The total number of records in the result set

numRecords.description: The number of records in the current response object
